page.title: 14CARNON DOWNS SURGERY
page.content: We walked into the surgery through a small front porch. After that we got to a waiting room and a reception office. We asked the receptionist if we could ask some questions for our Domesday project. She knew the name Domesday immediately so she took us to the nursing room. In the nursing room there was a bed, two chairs and a pair of scales for weighing babies. She told us that the surgery was open every weekday and that there were 3 doctors, a lady called Dr Tregaskill and doctors Stephens and Jackson. 30-40 patients are seen daily, aged from birth to 98 years. There are 4-5000 patients on their register. There is also a surgery in Devoran.
